newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Some Russian workers unpaid for 12 months - union.
newsitem.headline: Some Russian workers unpaid for 12 months - union.

text.p: A trade union official, lashing out at high and rising wage arrears, said on Wednesday that some Russian workers had not been paid for up to a year.
Mikhail Shmakov, chairman of Russia's Federation of Independent Trade Unions (FNPR) told the State Duma lower house of parliament that the issue could soon become explosive.
"Wage non-payment is the main problem which can blow up the situation in the country," Shmakov said, adding that unions planned strikes and protest meetings on November 5.
"Then there will be none of the (economic) stabilisation we are talking about in this hall and in the government."
Shmakov said total wage non-payment rose to 42.8 trillion roubles in October from about 20 trillion roubles in January.
He said average wage arrears were for five or six months, and some companies had not paid wages for over a year.
The State Statistics Committee said last week that total Russian wage arrears rose 40.2 trillion roubles on September 23 from 36.0 trillion on August 26.
